lesson-1.1.title: Declare a variable
lesson-1.1.description: We can use the var keyword in JavaScript to assign a name somewhere in memory. Below, create a variable called greeting by typing into the blue input box.

lesson-1.2.title: Assign a value to a variable
lesson-1.2.description: Words are represented in memory as a type of data  called "strings". To create a string, we surround a word with quotes. We can also store strings in our variables using the assignment operator (= sign). Store whatever string you want into our greeting variable.

lesson-1.3.title: Fill in the blanks
lesson-1.3.description: Using what you've learned, fill in the missing pieces of our code. You should end up with a program that stores a string in a variable.

lesson-1.4.title: Add two strings together
lesson-1.4.description: In JavaScript, we can add two strings together by using the addition operator (+ sign). Fill in two strings you want to add together in the boxes below.

lesson-1.5.title: Test your knowledge
lesson-1.5.description: Using what you've learned so far, create a new variable and assign it the value of any string you want.
